newScannedThrough: State of AI Report 2025 (Nathan Benaich/Air Street Capital, released Oct 2025)

newContent.title: State of AI Report 2025 - Enterprise Adoption Findings
findings: 44% of U.S. businesses now pay for AI tools (up from 5% in 2023), avg contract $530K
95% of professionals now use AI at work or home (survey of 1,200+)
76% pay for AI tools out of pocket
AI-first startups expand 1.5x faster than peers

newContent.title: Deloitte State of AI in Enterprise 2026
findings: Only 1 in 5 companies has mature governance model for autonomous AI agents despite rapid agentic AI adoption
AI skills gap is biggest barrier to enterprise AI integration
Education ranked #1 talent strategy adjustment, not role/workflow redesign
42% believe AI strategy highly prepared, but feel LESS prepared on infrastructure, data governance, risk, talent
2/3 report productivity gains, but only 34% describe impact as transformative
Companies with 40%+ projects in production expected to double in 6 months

summary: First scan of this source. State of AI Report 2025 (stateof.ai) provides enterprise adoption stats - 44% of US businesses paying for AI tools is notable. The more valuable find is Deloitte's State of AI in Enterprise 2026 (published Sept 2025) with strong organizational findings: governance gap for agentic AI (only 20% have mature models), skills gap as top barrier, and a revealing disconnect where companies feel prepared on strategy but less prepared on infrastructure/talent/risk. The education-over-restructuring finding aligns with our specimen observations about training investments.

potentialMechanisms.name: Governance Lag in Agentic AI
potentialMechanisms.description: Agentic AI adoption outpacing governance maturity - only 1 in 5 companies have mature oversight models
potentialMechanisms.source: Deloitte State of AI in Enterprise 2026

potentialMechanisms.name: Strategy-Capability Disconnect
potentialMechanisms.description: Organizations feel prepared on AI strategy but less prepared on infrastructure, data governance, risk management, and talent
potentialMechanisms.source: Deloitte State of AI in Enterprise 2026

notes: The Deloitte report (n=3,235 senior leaders) is methodologically stronger than most industry reports. The agentic AI governance gap is highly relevant to our specimen collection - could add as a field signal. The strategy-capability disconnect echoes patterns we see in specimens that announce AI initiatives but struggle with execution.
